author: wslyvh
content:
Any reason why someone would build empty blocks (or just incl. a few txs) as a validator? E.g. 
https://etherscan.io/block/16114268
https://etherscan.io/block/15786139

These don't seem to be related to MEV or censorship. Just an error?

author: wslyvh
content:
Then there's another category of blocks that only utilize <10% of block space. E.g. 
https://etherscan.io/block/16120136
https://etherscan.io/block/16120665
https://etherscan.io/block/16120598

author: wslyvh
content: I guess these are more likely related to MEV, or guaranteed tx ordering. Or would there be any other reasons?

author: wslyvh
content: If anyone's interested, I created a Dune dashboard to track network utilization https://dune.com/wslyvh/network-utilization

author: ralexstokes
content: empty blocks could just be a bug or some issue w/ infra s.t. the validator could not get a more full execution payload in time

author: ralexstokes
content: the stock block building algo right after the merge was "start with an empty execution payload in case the validator needs it ASAP" and only extend the payload as the EL has time

author: ralexstokes
content: so you can start to see timing things crop up where this becomes an issue

author: ralexstokes
content: and with small numbers of transactions you could see a similar reason where the EL builder prioritizes "local" transactions vs those received from gossip (this is a distinction at least geth has)

author: wslyvh
content: Got it. Just plain user/validator errors.. I guess I've been overthinking some of these things ðŸ˜…

author: wslyvh
content: wouldn't "local" transactions still mean private deals?

author: ralexstokes
content: it could be other more sophisticated things but it can be hard to tell

author: ralexstokes
content: "local" here means that it was a transaction submitted directly via RPC to the node, which could in turn be gossiped as well

author: ralexstokes
content: geth just has some priority for packing those types of transactions into a block vs others

author: .paulharris
content: For a while an EL was returning blocks with no transactions because they ran out of time to process i think...   any block is better than no block in terms of the network health, so it's possible that at times things end up empty...

author: wslyvh
content: Interesting. Thanks. Very helpful

author: potuz
content: Any validator at home using an older version of geth (in fact I'm not sure if the fix was released) will be using very little gas

author: potuz
content: https://twitter.com/vdWijden/status/1588463072251088896?s=19
